section.title: Engineering Change Log
section.simpara: This document records and tracks all proposed engineering changes that occur during development. An engineering change is a change proposed or identified as desirable during one process that affects other work products not part of the delivery of the current process. This document tracks these proposed changes, their evaluation, analysis, and the eventual resolution of these changes.

tr.td: Update class of valid input programs
Add Dyalog Reference to Reuse Analysis

formalpara.title: Description
formalpara.para: During Functional Specification, the Obj and Fix functions were discovered to have a number of missing or undesirable requirement implications. The following changes are suggested:

listitem.simpara: Amend Requirement 16 to require only implementing the monadic interface of the ⎕FIX function.
An additional requirement should state that the Obj function will produce a shared object in the given file name that has the same semantics and function bindings as defined in the namespace.
Requirements should be added to clarify the error reporting in the case of files that already exist when handling Obj output.

formalpara.title: Analysis
formalpara.para: The above requirements do not change the semantics of the requirements, and only refine them. They meet the intention of the project and should be implemented.

formalpara.title: Description
formalpara.para: Functional specification revealed a possible ambiguity in the description of requirement 21. Recommend the following:

listitem.simpara: That requirement 21 be changed to clearly indicate that only fully closed namespaces are accepted; that is, only accept namespaces with no free variable references.
Additionally, a new requirement prohibiting the use of the ⌶-beam should be included.
A new requirement prohibiting the use of the ⍎ function should be added.
Requirement 4 should be amended to specify D-fns, rather than Co-Dfns programs.
The new additions to the D-fns languages introduced by Co-Dfns should be added and fully defined.
It should be remarked that no assignment which changes the overall nameclass of a variable is allowed.
A requirement detailing the unsupported operators should be added. These operators include the & operator as well as the ⍠ operator.

formalpara.title: Analysis
formalpara.para: No semantic change is introduced based on the intention of the design, and are at an early enough stage so as to not affect more than the functional specification, so this should be implemented.

formalpara.title: Description
formalpara.para: The primary specification for the D-fns language appears in the Dyalog Programmer's Guide and Language Reference. This should be explicitly marked as the reference document for the semantics of the D-fns language.

formalpara.title: Analysis
formalpara.para: This clarifies a number of implied assumptions on the part of the specifications and development plans, and should be included.

formalpara.title: Description
formalpara.para: Clarify the exported functions that are produced by the compiler in the exported namespace to indicate that currently, only global array variables and functions will be exported. Operators and other such things will not. This should be entered into the requirements document.

formalpara.title: Analysis
formalpara.para: This is a semantic change from the existing requirements, but does not affect anything more than the functional specification, which has been amended to include these adjustments anyways. Additionally, it does not add any complexity, but simplifies the technical implemenation burden. The only visible change to the user is the removal of operators from the public interface, which is acceptable.

formalpara.title: Description
formalpara.para: Changes in the interface design are suggested by function specification. It is unnecessary to have the object functionality separate from the fix function. Additionally, analysis of the way that LLVM works indicates that requirement #32 is not feasible, and will not be adequately implemented. A new requirement is suggested to indicate failures that may originate from the LLVM Subsystem. This requires the following changes:

listitem.simpara: Add a new requirement that states an LLVM error will signal an INTERNAL ERROR.

formalpara.title: Analysis
formalpara.para: The change does not alter the functionality or intention of the compiler, but it does create a simplified interface and is worth doing. It reduces workload later on.

formalpara.title: Description

formalpara.title: Description
formalpara.para: The Tokenize function gives a malformed result.

formalpara.title: Analysis
formalpara.para: This is due to an unnecessarily complex set of code. It is difficult to verify this code, and it should not have made it through. Replacing the code with simpler code that can be proven should fix the malformation result.

formalpara.title: Description

formalpara.title: Analysis
